description: Nice when it works, but some trouble connecting to Intel MacOSX, and especially High Sierra. Initial connection is unstable, and only accesses remote device login screen, even for network administrators.

Only thing that initially connects to a Raspberry Pi 5, until they resolve some issues with RealVNC. 
Reminna won't connect and throws up a dialog to supply certificate based authentication, whereas TigerVNC just connects (and appropriately warns about fingerprint etc), username/password prompt, done. 
Fast and works well.
summary: Just worked - Ubuntu 22.04 on Lenovo Carbon X1 Gen9

description: I use TigerVNC in software testing in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. It helps me a lot to connect to various computer system, having different CPU architectures.

First of all, im typing this on my pinephone. This app works perfectly in conjunction with the touchpad emulator found at the link below and scaling set to 1.5x using wl-randr. With these tools I can access my desktop to complete a task easily. Havent tried using plasma or sxmo but assume it would work just fine. Havent tried remmina yet but figured this one was simple and quick.

https://gitlab.com/CalcProgrammer1/TouchpadEmulator

It just opens the connection quickly and perfectly, but it has no options like capture the keyboard (special keys).
You can configure some settings before connecting but once connected just nothing.
summary: Works great but lack of features

description:
It supouse to be very easy to install and configure, but its not.
First it ask to create manually a password, then you need to figure out details of your user interface and create manually an config with this information, I tried for a few minutes and give up in this steep, probally it have even like 10 more manually steeps to follow if you want it to work.
Other tools dont need anything, just run and its done.
Works great on my fedora OS, controlling my raspberrypi OS (4B).
Tried to connect to my rpi3 with Remmina, Connections, but it didn't work. TigerVNC saved the day! :-)
Not work to connect raspberry pi 4.
